metadata.title: CVE-2018-6065 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in computing the required allocation size wheninstantiating a new javascript object in V8 in Google Chrome prior to65.0.3325.146 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
